result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeramy Michael Vadner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeramy Michael Vadner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 13CF313, 13CF326 and Ct. 2 in 13CF391. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 13CF313, 13CF326 and Ct 2 in 13CF391. DE acknowledges responsibility for Ct. 7 in 14CF485.  Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 7 of 14CF485 for purposes of restitution and outright dismisses Ct. 1, 2, 3 ,4, 5 and 6. Court dismisses in 13CF313 Ct. 1 and 3, 13CF374, in 13CF391 Ct. 1, 3 and 4, 14CF113, 14CF283 and 14CF486.  Sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders: In 13CF326 sentence W/H
2 years probation. Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 
Conditions:
-60 days jail STAYED
  Credit for 16 days against any ultimate sentence. 
- AODA assesment and any recommended treatment.
- Regular and random testing. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- $625 Joint and several to be paid through DOC. 
- Costs 
- DE to attend MRT program and complete compass assessment.
- Follow through with any programing recommended by agent. 
- DE to maintain full time employment. 
- DE will be eligible for expungement upon sucessful completion of probation. 
 DE to report today to probation. 
Court orders $250.00 to be applied to restitution and the balance to be refunded to payor.
In 13CF313: 1 yr. probation with the same conditions in 13CF326.
Costs
In 13CF391: 1 yr. probation with the same conditions in 13CF326.
Costs
In 14CF485:
Restitution of $29.97.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jeramy Michael Vadner appeared.  Court called at 2:37 p.m.  Includes 13CF391, 14CF485 & 14CF486.  ADA Mckinley states there is a Jury Trial scheduled for the DE on February 23, 2015.  Continue PTC until after the Jury Trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 2:41 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk:Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jeramy Michael Vadner appeared.  Court called at 2:13 p.m.  Includes case 13CF391 (STC), 14CF485 (arraignment) & 14CF486 (arraignment). Court informs DE of charges in 14CF485 & 14CF486, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty.  Bond is continued.  Set for PTC.  Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State's. Filed by ADA McKinley. hml

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Jeramy Michael Vadner appeared. Includes PH on 14CF485 and 14CF486; 13CF391.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial for 14CF485 and 14486. Bond continue and 13CF391 to follow.  Arraignment scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
and NM to suppress filed by Atty Kucinski.  kc
Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Includes 14CF485 & 14CF486

-Bond is to be Co-Signed by JoAnne Erickson

-Defendant to reside with his Grandmother JoAnne Erickson.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

 -Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Jeramy Michael Vadner appeared from jail.   Includes 14CF485 & 14CF486. EJL will keep these files.  Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim is demanded. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
